thread.title: Finally getting some playing time, Marcus Smith impresses Eagles' Chip Kelly
thread.title_full: Finally getting some playing time, Marcus Smith impresses Eagles' Chip Kelly

author: Eliot Shorr-Parks | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Finally getting some playing time, Marcus Smith impresses Eagles' Chip Kelly
text:
Finally getting some playing time, Marcus Smith impresses Eagles' Chip Kelly New Orleans Saints v Philadelphia Eagles Marcus Smith #90 of the Philadelphia Eagles knocks down Drew Brees #9 of the New Orleans Saints as Andrus Peat #75 of the New Orleans Saints attempts to block Smith in the fourth quarter on October 11, 2015 at Lincoln Financial field in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The Eagles defeated the Saints 39-17. (Photo by Mitchell Leff | Getty Images) Comments 
PHILADELPHIA -- Although he would never say it, and certainly never has, it hasn't been hard to figure out that Eagles head coach Chip Kelly isn't too high on 2014 first-round pick Marcus Smith. 
Something that could maybe -- maybe -- be changing after the team's 39-17 win Sunday over the New Orleans Saints. 
"We were pleased getting him out there," said Kelly. 
Smith played 22 snaps against the Saints, a career high for the second-year player. Last season, in his rookie year, Smith played a total of 77 snaps, and never saw more than 18 in a single game. 
It might not be a coincidence that in the longest action of his career, Smith also had his best game, registering his first career tackle (ok, an assist on a tackle) and twice getting in the face of Saints quarterback Drew Brees. 
Smith also helped create a turnover with the Eagles up 32-10 and just under four minutes remaining in the game. 
"On Walter's interception yesterday, (Smith) used a one-armed bull rush, kind of pushed the offensive linemen back into Drew's face," Kelly said, "and Drew couldn't follow through on the throw." 
Smith's strong showing comes at an ideal time for the Eagles, who are thin at outside linebacker and have struggled to generate a pass rush this season. 
The game from Smith certainly won't erase the label he as been given of bust, but it does perhaps make the argument the label has been unfairly given. BRADFORD: Report card from win over Saints 
There is a reason Smith hasn't been playing, and plenty of it has to do with what he shows the coaches in practice. Officially labeling a player a bust after just 77 snaps, however, is premature, and Smith's strong showing in his first real, extended action in the NFL is exactly why. 
Still, it is going to take a lot more than 22 snaps to start working his way back into the good graces of Eagles fans and his head coach. 
Although for the first time in his career, it seems Smith might have finally taken the first step in doing so. 
"Overall," Kelly said, "he has shown improvement. THE NO-HUDDLE SHOW, Ep. 11: Finally, a glimpse of what Eagles fans expected 
There were plenty of encouraging signs in the Eagles' blowout win over the Saints. From Fletcher Cox's dominance to Josh Huff's emergence, the Eagles showed what they're capable of doing. Now the question is: Can they do it again vs. the Giants? Subscribe to the podcast on iTunes or Stitcher . 
Eliot Shorr-Parks may be reached at eshorrpa@njadvancemedia.com . Follow him on Twitter @EliotShorrParks . Find NJ.com Sports on Facebook.
